review_text: I was only able to stay one night in San Diego, however, I would have stayed for a month at this lovely home if I could. You can tell they love and care for the entire property and the fact that they are artists really shows. The studio (tower) that I stayed in was so peaceful and charming and I woke up to the sweetest birdsong. All of the spaces that you can see from the window and the studio's own private space are really lovely. I hope to go back to SD soon, and if this place is available that is where you'll find me.

name: Martin

review_text:
I stayed at Wolf's Tower which truly exceeded my expectations in every way. Wolf was amazing, providing not only great instructions before my arrival but also ensuring a seamless check-in and check-out process. His attention to detail made the entire experience incredibly stress-free.
The place itself was exactly as described. It was clean and smelled great and had everything a person could need! One of the best aspects of this Airbnb was its privacy and quietness. Perfect escape away from the bustle.
The location in the North Park neighborhood was perfect. It was easily walkable to a park and eateries, making it easy to immerse myself in the locality.
Parking, which can often be a hassle, was surprisingly easy at this location. I never had any issues finding a spot, which was a huge relief.
Lastly, the host's hospitality shone through in every aspect of my stay, making it a memorable and enjoyable experience. I highly recommend The Tower!

Wolf's dedication to keeping the airbnb clean upon arrival, both inside and outside, was very apparent, as I didn't notice anything that raised a red flag in terms of blemishes or sanitation. All in all, I believe that anyone who chooses to rent from Wolf will be very impressed with what they pay for, and he receives my highest recommendation as a host.

Kitchen is wonderful- tiny but perfect for a solo person’s needs. The television is difficult to use and froze multiple times but I doubt many of us are here for the television when the grounds/surrounding areas are so beautiful. Water pressure in shower is extremely strong, go easy on the tap and you’ll be alright. Such a beautiful space decorated by artists while being art itself.

My stay at the tower was so wonderful and exactly what I needed for my trip. As a solo female, I felt safe, comfortable and welcomed. This space felt clean, minimalistic, and put me at ease.
One thing I will bring next time will be a shower cap. The showerhead pours directly down, so if you’re not trying to wash your hair that day :) bring a shower cap.
I really look forward to staying back at Wolf and Blair‘s Airbnb next time I’m traveling to San Diego or even check out their other Airbnb on the property for myself and my family.

I was thrilled to stay at this location close to where a friend lives in North Park. The space is cozy, but still has plenty of room for flexible use of the space. It’s perfectly decorated and I found myself regularly exploring the art and books in the space.
One note for people with larger bodies: the shower is incredibly small. This isn’t a problem with the shower, just something folks should be aware of if they prefer or need a little more room to move freely while showering.
I loved this space and thoroughly enjoyed my stay!

review_text: Pros: Nice small space in a quiet neighborhood, and a super-quick walk to Balboa Park, and to North Park restaurants and bars, which was perfect for me. Instructions for finding the key and getting in were very clear. Cons: A little hot during the day, and a little cold at night. Found a little fan tucked away in the closet which was helpful to keep air moving, but still a little stuffy; would recommend the owner install a ceiling fan if possible. But still worth the stay.

review_text: My son and I had a peaceful, lovely stay at Wolf's studio. It's in a great location close to Balboa Park, and it was fun to explore the area on foot. The neighborhood is so nice, full of great architecture and fantastic gardens. We really enjoyed walking to some wonderful restaurants, and the neighborhood felt very safe. We loved watching the hummingbirds in the beautiful bougainvillea outside on the balcony and watching the amazing sunsets. The place is immaculately clean, safe, and comfortable. We were given all the space we needed to have privacy, but felt that if we needed anything, our host was available, and that was a nice feeling.

name: Tanya
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
·
October 2023
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Stayed at Wolf's place for 4 nights for work and had a great stay here!
Pros: Wolf is highly responsive and courteous, instructions to access the unit were clear, neighborhood was so peaceful yet close to tons of restaurants/breweries and parking was surprisingly easy considering its North Park. Very cute balcony space and unit got a lot of lovely light during the day!
Things to consider: The shower was very small, so it was manageable for me as a 5'3 individual but may be tight for some others. Kitchenette has 2 stove top burners and a mini toaster, but no microwave (which would be more helpful as someone who kept having leftovers from eating out). The space is definitely for 2 max but I think its more comfortable for individuals traveling alone.
Overall, I had a comfortable stay as I was mostly out and about and valued the safety, location, and accessibility of things to do more!

review_text:
The tower studio was wonderful. So bathed in light, I enjoyed just reading and writing in the space. The picture window opposite the bed looked out onto 2 beautiful palms - there were views from each of the 6 windows. Shower was good and the kitchen had everything we needed.
Close to Balboa Park and the San Diego Zoo, not a long drive to the beach for sunset and Old Town San Diego was fun too. As an added bonus, I got to meet Wolf and his wife and enjoyed talking with them - lovely couple!
I highly recommend this place!

Where this place fell short for me was the cleanliness of the place. Towels had strains, and the bed had hair on it. It was hot most days, and the wall AC unit wasn't up to pair. TLDR; nice place, but for a couple extra dollars, a hotel is the way to go.

review_text:
Wolf's Tower studio was a perfect place for myself as a solo traveler. It was cozy but well lit and airy. Parking was easy and instructions were clear on how to get it in. The property is in a safe neighborhood, enclosed behind a locked gate for added security, and an easy 10 minute stroll to coffee, ramen, and other restaurants/bars.
The bed was very comfortable, the towels were soft, and I appreciated that the water pitcher had filtered water ready to go when I checked in. If I'm ever in the area I plan to stay here again.

review_text: Great place in a beautiful, quiet and walkable neighborhood at a reasonable rate. Check-in/ check-out and directions were clearly communicated by the host ahead of my stay. The best part, without a doubt, was the proximity to the plethora of amazing restaurants, coffee shops, bars and boutiques in North Park. The shower cubicle was a tad too small even for a petite lady like myself, but the rest of the space was well-lit and inviting and thereby made up for it. I look forward to staying here again on my next visit to SD!

name: Sophie

Rating, 5 stars

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
A little gem! This cute studio has everything you need even for a ~week-long stay. I was in town for a wedding weekend and decided to stay a few extra days. The location is quiet with pretty easy street parking. At the same time it's easy to walk to cute coffee shops and restaurants in 5-10 minutes. Best of both worlds
Check-in instructions were given in advance and were very clear. Same with checkout.
The studio itself is so cute. Small but mighty. It's cozy but has lots of light from the windows. Some cool books, and cute little (handmade?) illustrations. Could not have been happier. Also the porch is so nice to sit on in the morning drinking your coffee or any other time of day or night.
Wifi is solid, water pressure is excellent, even beach towels are supplied. Thanks for a great stay!

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
The check-in process couldn’t have been easier. The tower room felt private and safe, and was cozy. The location is close to many restaurants and breweries.
The interior would be charming if it was updated a little. The walls need a coat of paint, the desk was reminiscent of old student housing, and there are mildew stains on the wood around the towel hangers in the bathroom.
A little effort and it would be very cute. As it was, it was practical and efficient.

review_text: My boyfriend and I traveled to San Diego and it was perfect for a one night stay! Wolf was very accommodating (check-in time is after 3 but he allowed us to check in an hour early) and he responded quickly (less than thirty minutes after I would reach out to him). The entire studio is basically one room with a bed, small kitchen, desk, and connecting bathroom, but it was very comfortable. Everything was clean and looked almost new. Wolf also left us a map of the area and recommendations, which we really appreciated. We felt safe in the area and the location was beautiful. My only gripe is that the shower was very small and hard to move around in, but it got the job done. I would definitely stay here again :)

,

,
·
Stayed over a week
review_text: Overall, I enjoyed my two weeks (solo) at this location. I wouldn’t recommend it for multiple travelers, or anyone hoping to cook - the kitchen is extremely small and shares space with the only closet. Pay close attention to check out instructions - I had an unfortunate experience where Wolf charged me an additional $50 because I didn’t clean the place to an acceptable level before I checked out. Given I was already paying an $80 cleaning fee, I wasn’t expecting an additional charge, regardless of dishes in sink and unmade bed. Also, my car was broken into while parked on the street outside. The neighborhood seemed perfectly safe otherwise, but just worth noting.

The place will provide your needs if you are staying for a few nights. The bathroom and bed were a little smaller than anticipated, especially for two adults. Also the bed was not extremely comfortable, but again it is a place to lay your head down after a full day out and about. Great communication and no noise issues.

Wolf was quick to respond and allowed us some flexibility. We found the check in/out instructions clear and helpful. The 2 nights we spent there were quiet, comfortable and a great location, walking distance to the heart of North Park (and to our son’s apt). The space is a cute little studio -and comes with all the amenities you need, including a little kitchenette, closet space and a work desk. We would stay there again!

rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
January 2024
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: We were so lucky to find this little gem for such a good price in San Diego! It was easy to find and there was plenty of parking (free!!!) on the street in a safe, quiet residential neighborhood. The location is only about 15 minutes from everything if you avoid rush hour traffic. The apartment is a detached guest house behind the main house and is very private, with large windows that look out over their beautiful, naturally landscaped, backyard. The bed was large and comfortable. There is a twin-size pullout couch that my daughter thought was amazing - she got to watch tv in bed! 😂 The minifridge and microwave were useful, and there is a heater/ac unit that kept us warm at night. The bathroom is large and updated, and the decor throughout the house was charming. We didn't need to reach out to Cory while we were there, but he checked with us right after we arrived to make sure we got in okay, and let us know to reach out if we had any questions. Perfect stay!

Stayed a few nights
review_text: Cory's bungalow was absolutely amazing! His hospitality was so appreciated, as well. The space is exactly as it appears in the photos-- spacious, centrally located (about 15 mins max from all the hot spots), clean, and so comfortable! My only complaint is that I couldn't just move in!! Cory made check-in and out super simple and was so friendly. I encountered some hiccups that Cory was kind enough to help me sort out in order to ensure my trip went off without a hitch. The views from the backyard and room are not lacking whatsoever and there's so much space; i was able to fully immerse myself into vacation mode and relax like I haven't ever been able to before in an Airbnb. No detail of this fun space was missed. The bed was comfortable, the pillows were perfectly soft. There's an AC unit in it as well to help beat the SoCal heat which was such a nice amenity. The bathroom is also spacious and the cherry on top of this spot. I cannot wait to visit San Diego again and when I do, I will most definitely be re-booking with Cory. Do not pass this spot up!!!

review_text: What a cute and spacious bungalow! We loved everything about it. It was very clean and the bed was very comfortable. It has a fireplace that added an even more romantic feel. The backyard which we had access to the whole time has a BBQ, bistro lights and several nice seating areas to enjoy sunset and lounging. There is a fire table which we did not use but we hope to next time we visit. Cory was the best host. He was very responsive and helpful by letting us borrow a few items we forgot for our BBQ. Coffee in the room and waters were an added bonus. It was the perfect proximity to SDSU which was the reason we were there. Even our college kids made positive comments about how nice the backyard was when they joined us for a home cooked BBQ meal. We will definitely visit again. Thanks Cory!

Stayed a few nights
review_text: We were actually quite blown away by this one-room air bnb. Inside a locked gate are plants, flowers, a koi pond, a grill, a table & chairs & a big parking space. Inside is too adorable. It is filled with cute beachy pics and other decor and is incredibly well appointed. Inside is everything you could ask for. There is a large, very comfortable bed, desk and chair, (fold-out) couch, coffee table, 2 luggage stands, mirrors, blinds & curtains, nightstands, a dresser, wardrobe with hangers, refrigeratior, microwave, and the 86" tv. Then there are many considerate extras - keurig with to-go cups, tea bags, honey sticks, robes, ac, great shower, ceiling fan, extension cord outlets, robes, bottles of water, ample fluffy towels, ear plugs, cotton pads, Q-tips, lighted make-up mirror, wine and beer openers and cups and more. There is even an electric fireplace! The host lent me a hat upon my request. The family is friendly. Quick walk to restaurants & the beach. We loved it!

Stayed with kids
review_text: Quyen's guesthouse was very clean, comfortable and safe. We had a car, so the gated parking was nice. Free street parking was also nice for our adult daughter who visited us (easy spots were always open in front of property). The amenities were so appreciated (robes, waters, TV with apps, beach toys/chairs/towels, outdoor shower & towel rack). They thought of everything! The walk to the beach was a little further than we thought, mainly because the access takes you to a perfect surfing location first - however, the location is right between Pacific Beach and LaJolla beaches, making for a short drive either way. If you are surfing, then this is the perfect place!You can't see the ocean from the property, but the garden is beautiful and relaxing for an evening drink on the patio or coffee in the morning. It's much more quiet then staying in one of the busy beach towns such as Mission or PB, which this family of three appreciated.

review_text: This place is a hidden gem! It's just a little bit further from the usual beach side properties, but Tourmaline and other beaches are literally minutes' walk away. La Jolla downtown and groceries are also within walking distance. The cottage itself is very beautifully furnished,very clean, and the garden outside is amazing. The free amenities like Nespresso are great as well. Due to lockdown, we did eat a lot more in and would have preferred some plates, dishes and silverware, but the plastic silverware, microwave and mini fridge helped make it easier. We loved Quyen's place and would recommend it to anyone planning to visit SD. If you're visiting with kids, I highly recommend driving to children's pool beach for some up-close seal viewing.

Rating, 5 stars
,
·
October 2019
,
·
Stayed one night
review_text:
I stayed here for one night and enjoyed my time.
Pros:
A lot of folks noted that Quyen goes out of his way to provide every amenity thinkable: beach towels, shampoo +conditioner, etc, but it’s just incredible to see the level of care into these details
The location is great too. Quick walk to Pacific Beach and several very popular restaurants. A quick uber ride to bars on Garter street.
The novelty: the guest house has a cool minimalist decor and it’s solar powered
Clarity. Quyen outlines check out procedures in a binder by the door. There’s labels for every remote and every electronic device
Cons:
All the remote control devices/information overload got a little overwhelming. I had one for the TV, AC unit, fireplace, and fan.
The door you enter/exit from faces the host’s house so sometimes they see you or you see them. I’m sort of a self conscious person so I was surprised to see/hear people so easily.
Overall, it’s a great spot I’d recommend to anyone.

review_text:
This Point Loma studio was the perfect escape for my San Diego staycation. Looking for relaxation, I found it in spades. The studio itself was private and cozy, offering a tranquil atmosphere that melted away all my stress. I was so inspired by the aesthetic and loved all the interesting books and artwork in the space.
Michael was incredibly responsive throughout my stay, making sure I had everything I needed. Communication was a breeze, which is always a huge plus.
Parking was easy and a major perk, especially during a staycation when you might be coming and going frequently.
Their garden was truly a hidden gem. This unexpected delight was the absolute highlight. Still dreaming about having my morning coffee surrounded by all that greenery. The lemons I got to take home with me were the perfect memento from my stay.
Overall, this Point Loma studio exceeded my expectations. It offered a perfect blend of privacy, relaxation, and thoughtful touches.

Michael’s place was perfectly located in Point Loma Heights, minutes away from Liberty Station and very close to the Sunset Cliffs - it was the perfect jumping off point for any of our activities in SD. Beautiful view of their garden and lovely, peaceful pathway leading to the unit. I would stay again.
Things to note: the shower is a little on the shorter side, if you’re over 5’9” you may feel a little squished in there. The airplane traffic (which is listed) could bother some but didn’t bother us, if you’re sensitive, bring earplugs because the place is worth it!

review_text:
I'm giving this place a five-star rating, but I must say that there's a lot of airplane traffic. If you're thinking of opening the windows, be aware that planes take off every 10-15 minutes. The property has double windows, which reduce the noise, but you can still hear it. Other than that, the place was great.
We had a great chat with Michael's Mexican gardener about all the vegetables he has growing there. Michael offered us anything that was ready to eat, and we highly recommend the passion fruit. Sergio told us to cut it in half and suck on the seeds. It was delicious!
Hope this helps. Safe travels! Watch our vlog: @sperryndipitytravel 🤙🏻

Location was about 10-20 minutes to everything we wanted to see. Highly recommend checking out Liberty Public Market and catching the sunset over at Sunset Cliffs. Just a minor note that this is close to the airport so if you are a light sleeper maybe bring a white noise machine but a floor fan was provided and the windows are double-paned.

It was in close proximity to both sides of San Diego that we wanted to see. Additionally, the recommendation of Ortiz Taco Shop was a 15/10 on my husband's taco scale. If we ever visit San Diego again we would check to see if Michael's airbnb is available.

Can’t wait to return again!! Note: I could hear the airplanes overhead if you’re a light sleeper there’s a google home (Alexa) and I played white noise so it wasn’t a problem for me. I have given this spot 5 stars, and I stand by that. That being said, I want to note a for future travelers:
Planes fly low overhead at regular intervals. The space is pretty well sound dampened, but it was still quite noticeable. Once I got used to it, it wasn't as big of an issue, but I felt it was something worthy of mentioning
Michael was incredibly accommodating and answered a few questions I had very quickly. Should I return to San Diego, I would definitely consider this spot again. Very close to some great restaurants, and between 20-30 minutes from a number of other popular tourist spots. Was an excellent stay!

If you want a quiet getaway that's clean and worth your money, then you found it.
Although I was worried after reading some reviews about the connecting door and airplane noises, both were never a problem during my stay. (There's a blind that covers the whole door, so it felt like an independent room)
I love minimalistic rooms and plants, so Michael's place really hit the spot for me. Then there was a great view, a clean bathroom, smart TV, and a virtual assistant that made the stay even better.
There's no doubt this will be my go-to Airbnb in SD.
Thank you for having us. :)

Stayed a few nights
review_text: This Airbnb was one of my favorite parts of me and my friend’s 3-day vacation and turned out to be an air conditioned oasis since our trip fell on the week of a historic heat wave! The heat forced us to stay inside for hours at a time, which we didn’t mind at all since we got some good Netflix time on a big screen and soaking in the natural light and incredible views. It was close to everything we did (Torrey Pines State Park was the farthest at 25 minutes away, Mission Beach, Sunset Cliffs, North Park, Liberty Station just 5 minutes away!!), everything was clean, and Michael was super responsive to any questions we had. Stop looking, trust me—just book it already 😎

review_text: Michael's place is excellent for solo travellers or couples. On top of the benefits of having a separate entrance (with a beautifully maintained garden pathway) and being in a calm & quiet neighborhood, this accommodation was neat, clean, abundantly lit and airy, and comfortable. There is ample furniture in the space too - from a very comfortable bed to work-desks and armchairs. Michael was a great host too - always quick with communication and helpful with recommendations. Some folks might find the lack of a kitchen slightly awkward (though there is a fridge, microwave, and a coffee maker). However, we had no issues accessing food from a great range of nearby restaurants. Highly recommend staying here!

Michael was an awesome host who provided us with very valuable information and was always available if we had questions. Would definitely stay here again, highly recommended!

·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Michael’s place is a great stay for solo travelers to hang out in San Diego. It is close to many activities and restaurants with just a short drive. The check-in process was easy and Michael was respectful and left me alone my entire stay. I appreciate having my own entrance and bathroom (I don’t like to disturb others with my coming and going, especially when it comes to using the bathroom). I’m 5’9” and the shower was a good size for me, but might be a little small for taller individuals. The shower head was awesome and I loved it. The mattress was too soft for me, but that is a personal preference (I got used to sleeping on firm mattresses to alleviate back aches). Overall, well worth the value for a small vacation.

review_text:
Cozy studio, perfect for our trip! Michael was quick to respond and very helpful!Things to be aware of:
• shower stall is indeed small and shower head is low. This wasn't a problem for us, we're both under 5'9, but it may be uncomfortable for taller guests. However, water heat and pressure was great!!
•steps down the side to access the room are rough stone, easy enough to navigate on foot, but may be tricky with rolling luggage or a stroller. Steps are lit at night!
•The room got a little chilly at night but the provided space heater made all the difference.
•Mini-fridge provided, microwave not.
The room has excellent natural light and would be great for an artist. Tons of spare linens and pillows available, and the mattress was super comfortable!
I'd definitely stay again or recommend to a friend.

Stayed a few nights
review_text: I had a wonderful time at Michael's. The location is great. You can easily walk to so many places including the beaches and Liberty Station. The neighborhood felt very safe and was quiet my entire stay. Parking on the street was very easy. You're only about a 10-15 minute drive from most attractions. If you're a single or couple always on the go this is a great place to crash. The location does have frequent airplane traffic but as someone who is sensitive to noise, I got used to it on the second day when inside. Planes fly from 6:30am-11:30pm. The shower could pose an issue for wide and tall people. Wifi is not good for video conferencing and TV connection dropped often.

Stayed about a week
review_text: An awesome experience, great location at a great value. The room is bigger than it looks in pictures and very private, including a private garden space with your own table-top fire pit and nightly firework shows thanks to Sea World. Street parking was no problem and was in walking distance to a lot of restaurants and shops; particularly Liberty Station (google it). Super convenient to the beach....almost like staying in OB but without the sketch. Stylish space.

name: Hailey
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
March 2021
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
This place is absolutely perfect for a nice trip to San Diego. It was very clean upon arrival and Checkin was easy using the digital key pad. The side entrance provided complete privacy during our stay.
The back yard is amazing. The family has a gorgeous garden with multiple beds filled with edible foods. There is even a little greenhouse. My dog was able to run around safely since the yard is fenced. It is also separate from the main house so it feels very private.
The patio in the yard includes a super nice propane fire pit to relax during the evenings. Sunsets and night views are breathtaking!
The shower is a bit small but fully stocked with everything you could need which was a plus.
A nespresso machine, mini fridge, and microwave make up the kitchenette which worked perfect by allowing my to have a morning coffee and then try out some of the lovely restaurants recommended by the host.
The area is very quiet atop the hills between Point Loma and ocean beach. This location is perfect as you are close enough to both to be very convenient. We went to the beach every day, got lunch in Point Loma, and then the freeway is still only 10 minutes away.
Thank you for an amazing stay, we will surely be back!

review_text:
This home was exactly what we needed for our quick trip to SD. Upon entering the home everyone’s first reaction was how clean the space felt and smelled!
It was plenty spacious for four guests and the bed were so comfortable. We used Uber most everywhere while we were there and it was centrally located about 5-10 minutes from anything you’d wanna do. There is a free parking space dedicated to the guests which was so nice to see in this area. The shower was great and the price was so worth it!
Stu was so nice the whole time and accommodated an early check in for us and even let us stash our bags there for a moment before before our flight. He alone earns this place 5 stars! Overall, this will be our only place we wanna stay for future visits 😍

review_text: Stu's place was lovely for a last-minute trip to San Diego. It's located very close to the airport and the I-5 but is tucked away from all the noise. Was very easy to get to Balboa Park and Little Italy. Highlights were the cute front balcony, very large sectional, and breakfast nook. Recommend for anyone seeking peace and quiet plus convenient access to freeway! Stu was very responsive and quickly delivered missing toilet paper and trash bags. The two things I would flag is that the home felt a little bit dusty and perhaps had remnants of pet dander/smells as I felt my mild allergies act up. As mentioned before, the parking spot is a bit tight and involves hopping half of a short curb. Street parking was not readily available in the immediate vicinity on a Friday night but was totally open on a Thursday evening.

The stay itself was just as pictured. Very clean and spacious. Had all the amenities as well. Stu was a great host and very responsive. I recommend this place for sure!

There was so many cute places and restarurants to visit nearby. It was so convenient to the Airport, but it did not even feel like it. It felt like we were in a small town. I've always booked hotels for family trips in the past, but Stu's place has made me an Airbnb convert! I can not recommend his place highly enough. You can tell he makes every effort to make his guests feel at home. The property housed the four of us very comfortably - definitely an upgrade from the two hotel rooms I was going to book!
If you're in the San Diego area, and want to stay somewhere with all the comforts of home, look no further than Stu's place. We'll be going back there for sure!

Group trip
review_text:
Stu’s place was perfect for our weekend trip. It’s on the second floor and near the airport. So if your a light sleeper that may not work for you (so keep that in mind).
The neighborhood was calm and quiet. There was a gastropub down the block and a cocktail bar a block and half away. Near the fwy. Good location.
The home had everything we needed. Towels, shampoo, conditioner, body wash, kitchen utensils and accessories (which we didn’t use, but it’s there if you need it), fridge & freezer (thank you for the ice!), & stove.
The beds were comfortable. The couch was comfortable. The location was a 10-20min drive away from everything we needed to do that weekend, UCSD graduation.
It comes with one parking spot. We had two cars and didn’t have a hard time finding parking for the second car, so parking was ok. Check in was easy and Stu was very communicative. I would consider booking Stu’s place again!

review_text: We had an amazing stay at this cute beach bungalow in the heart of Mission Beach! The one-story elevation provided just the right amount of privacy and a lovely peek at the beautiful Pacific. The location is unbeatable, with both the beach and bay just a few minutes away. We highly recommend this spot for anyone looking to experience the best of San Diego's beach life. Jacqui was a super friendly and responsive host. Five stars!

name: Serena
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
1 week ago
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: The best Airbnb I’ve stayed at!! I’m from CA and have visited SD many times, but this trip was particularly memorable largely because of Jacqui’s beachside home. The apartment was beautifully decorated with such cozy, thoughtful details and amenities (a large king bed, plenty of towels & toiletries, as well as a Nespresso coffee machine!), in a stunning location just steps from the beach. The neighborhood itself is lovely too, the inner streets/pathway to the beach vaguely reminded me of streets in Spain, and there’s a paved walking path that stretches across Mission Beach where you can go on a walk with a gorgeous view. During the weekend we enjoyed going to Cafe Tropics for açaí bowls and there’s a Starbucks within walking distance as well fyi. Thank you Jacqui for such an amazing stay!

name: Stefanie
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
1 week ago
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: You know your vaca is great when you wish you could have stayed another day! Jacqui's place was spotless, she responded instantly with any questions we had (honestly, best ever and we have been utilizing Airbnb before it was popular!) and you can't beat the location! Nestled in between the bay and beach, you just had to step outside and decide which direction to walk; only a few steps to get to either. Everyone wants 'beachfront' but for us, we like privacy, less noise and not staring at massive crowds of people marching by and feeling like we are on display. Her block, despite being so close to the beach, was so peaceful with the smell of flowers not humanity; we walked or rode our bikes everywhere. Tons to do and so much fun! I would highly recommend staying here!

review_text:
We stayed here for 3 nights and it was our first time staying in Misson Beach. We aren't much for the bar scene but thought this location was just enough out of the way for the night life. It was also a very easy location for the early ride to the airport.
The location was just steps away from the beach so we enjoyed early morning walks and sunset walks. It was perfect. Jaqui's place was well kept and stocked with a few unopened drinks from the previous guest. The shower has very good water pressure and super hot water, which is always a plus after long days.
The kitchen sink seemed a little clogged and I messaged Jaqui right away as a heads up and she was very responsive.
Lastly it was easy to check in and quick with a keyless entry. We were able to park our Range Rover Evoque in the garage.
I would definitely recommend this place to anyone visiting.

Stayed a few nights
review_text: Cozy upstairs apartment with everything needed on vacation. The location cannot be beat - unless you pay the price for beachfront - but this is as close as it gets. We parked the car in the garage when we arrived and didn't take it anywhere until we left town - we were able to get around to everything in Mission Beach by bike or walking. Real Perks = garage with opener, gas stove, toiletries provided in bathroom, beach chairs, boogie boards and umbrellas (shared by all guests in building), cute courtyard patio with lighting for sitting outside in the evening or for morning coffee. We enjoyed a few meals at Luigi's and Draft - recommend both. All in all, a great place to stay. Unfortunately we probably won't be return visitors since the pet policy has changed, but really enjoyed our stay here.

Our only warning: beware of just how compact that garage spot is! Like the posting says, it’s not for larger cars but even our rental compact vehicle was a tight squeeze. We LOVED having on-site parking but it definitely took a few attempts to get in with the other cars parked in the alley. Overall, great Airbnb!

The bed was cloud-like comfortable and we slept well. We were able to sign into our streaming apps with out issue. I worked everyday and wifi was nice and strong.
Jacqui was also sweet enough to drop off a couple of things that I requested like a space heater.
Jaqui and her family are so sweet. Highly recommend!!

My travel partner and myself weren’t there much during the daytime, but there is construction next door and they do start at 7am. Was mildly annoying in the morning (more so on Saturdays). Beds were some form of memory foam, but neither myself or my travel partner found them comfortable.

Stayed with kids
review_text:
This home was the best choice for me and my family. We came to San Diego for our Spring Break to enjoy the beach, Legoland and SeaWorld. The home is central to most tourist attractions and easy to get around in the city, blocks from stores, coffee shops and restaurants.
The 2 story townhouse was perfect with the 2 bedrooms and main bathroom upstairs. The kitchen has new quality appliances, plenty of cook and dishware, microwave, coffee maker, and toaster oven. In this kitchen remodel no detail was left undone even down to the gorgeous backsplash. The living room has a huge smart HDTV. There is a half bath off of the living room with a stackable washer and dryer very tastefully done. After sightseeing all day the absolute best part of returning to this beautiful home was having not one, but two dedicated parking places. Everything was just wonderful with my rental and when I return in the fall, I will be renting again. Edward was very easy to work with and always quick to respond.

Great house to stay in Pacific Beach. Good size rooms with comfortable furniture and an amazing kitchen with modern appliances. It was perfect for me since I cook a lot.
Also having a dishwasher and a massive laundry machine makes life so much easier especially in San Diego which seems like a rare amenity.
The host was very kind and brought us pastries on two Sundays which was a nice treat.
A minor thing is there was construction next door and some times they start hammering at 7am which was annoying but I understand that's out of their control.
All in all, a great place to stay at when you compare everything else that's available nearby.
I would totally recommend my friends stay at this house in the future.

Stayed one night
review_text: I found Antonio’s Airbnb and was drawn to the photos and the great deal. I quickly booked, and Antonio was responsive accommodating. My request for an added package. Instructions were provided upon arrival with step-by-step video instructions on how to access and utilize all the amenities, which was convenient, I believe that the location provided rustic charm cabin fill and fit the description. I know some of the other reviews mentioned the size of the bedding, which is a tight squeeze. If you have a larger frame, however due to the size of the room itself the full size is what makes sense so expect that. All the expected amenities were there the kitchenette, coffee maker, wine glasses, iron, which is convenient. I also appreciate the fact that they had a shower caddy so you don’t have to put your loofah or soaps on the floor of the shower. Some people may not care about this, but I do appreciate the fact that they use the good quality, thick, ply, toilet paper.

This is a gem of a spot in La Mesa for a quiet stay with access to grocery and restaurants in walking distance. The view from the rooftop terrace is incredible especially at night. Antonio is extremely proactive and responsive as a host, provides great local recommendations, and was very accommodating with our relatively late arrival. Recommend this spot in a heartbeat!

We had an excellent time here. The host was very responsive. It was a fun experience. One of the most unique Airbnb’s I’ve ever stayed at. The host had a video to help you with anything you might need and a book of local suggestions.
Easy parking was a relief! We were able to park right on the street by the house. I also appreciated that the host had an extension cord right by each bedside so you didn’t have to go searching for it. That was a simple but very nice touch!
I also enjoyed the outdoor area above the airbnb with beautiful views of the city. Just to note it isn’t private and is right in front of the main house. Which doesn’t take away from the view just know that part isn’t secluded from the main home like the airbnb is.
Overall wonderful and would highly recommend

name: Ricardo

,
·
Stayed one night
review_text:
The guest house is an intimate space tucked away on a hill in beautiful La Mesa. We opted for the “I’m in the mood” amenity and added a floral arrangement. We were supplied with a candlelit (electric candles), romantic music, cobblestone room covered in decorative rose petals and with an electric fireplace (super cute).
One bottle of champagne, 4 delicious cupcakes and 2 water bottles were in the mini fridge (there is a small freezer section in the fridge)
There was a coffee machine, microwave and toaster.
The room had 2 sinks with running water (kitchenette and bathroom).
The bathroom is sectioned off with a barn style door. The shower was lovely and had both natural and electric lighting. The entire place was incredibly tidy.
Bathroom had 2 full size towels and 4-6 hand towels.
The A/C worked beautifully (we set it to 68 degrees)
The hot water was not working but it was resolved within 15 minutes after contacting the host.
There is also a binder of things to do!
10/10 would return

review_text:
Perfect spot for couples to get away,
This neighborhood offers some good hiking if you enjoy hills and stairs or possibly a stroll to a local restaurant. We are an active couple so it was a added bonus.
The house is very unique. The round house is on the property of an additional house, it was an original pottery studio for the main home. However, I did not see the owners except in the morning when they left.
The only downside to this home is it quite noisy at night, a-lot of traffic, sirens, and the trolley can be heard. I would bring ear plugs in there future to ensure a restful snooze, but would stay again. Don’t let it deter you from the experience. It is worth it. Very romantic spot.

We had a wonderful stay at the round house! Antonio John made it so easy for us to find the Airbnb, including step by step directions using a YouTube link for our convenience. When we got there, it was dark, so we appreciated knowing exactly where we were going!
We were grateful for the other videos we could have access to ahead of time, such as the ones with directions about lights, shower, sink, and rooftop access. When we arrived, we felt like we had already familiarized ourselves with the house and we didn’t have to guess. That being said, we knew the video folder was private and secure. Antonio John really makes things crystal clear for guests!
As guests, we didn’t indulge in any of the packages offered, mostly because we were spending Thanksgiving with family, but we did feel that Antonio John went above and beyond in offering extra amenities.

review_text: The communication between host and guest was fantastic. We felt as if we were his # 1 priority. Before arriving Antonio(host) spared no time in letting us know where to park safely. Getting on-site is no problem, just follow his instructions and everything will run smooth. I asked for 2 packages from his bundle of choices. All of which were executed perfectly. I highly recommend adding a package if the occasion calls for it or if you have a sweet tooth. Upon entering everything was beautifully set up and easily accessible. I would recommend bringing your own body soap but other then that the place was awesome! Lots of food and bar choices nearby as well as plenty of shopping spots. Antonio(host) recommends plenty of good choices ranging from historical sites, restaurants, drinking spots and plenty more. Highly recommend a stay here!

My girlfriend and I stayed here for our anniversary and I did the extra “in the mood” package for her and that was definitely worth it as well. Parking is so convenient here. They literally let you use their driveway.
Literally my favorite Airbnb I have ever stayed in! Book it!!!

review_text:
This place is not as described. Much smaller then pictures make
it seem. The cottage is located on a property with apartments, very limited privacy. People and a dog walked across the top of the cottage during our stay which was very loud inside the cottage. We stayed in June and the A/C did not keep the unit cool, Antonio did bring us a fan but it wasn’t enough during daytime. Once checked in Antonio did reply quickly to texts, but I reached out a few times prior to our stay and he didn’t reply. Also he sent the lock box code after the 4:00 check-in. Place was not clean and there was a broken frig right outside our front door. Big disappointment and not worth the expense. Would not recommend!
